title: Gelding
summary: A gelding is a castrated male horse or other equine, such as a pony, donkey or a mule. Castration, as well as the elimination of hormonally driven behavior associated with a stallion, allows a male equine to be calmer and better-behaved, making the animal quieter, gentler and generally more suitable as an everyday working animal.[1]  The gerund and participle "gelding" and the infinitive "to geld" refer to the castration procedure itself.
